long: Meaning: to "stray" (causatively, "mislead"), usually (figuratively) to "mistake", especially (morally) to "transgress"; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) "to reel", (figuratively) "be enraptured".  Usage: (cause to) go astray, deceive, err, be ravished, sin through ignorance, (let, make to) wander.  Source: a primitive root;
